mainHero.title: Product Snapshot:
mainHero.subtitle: A Data Analytics Tool for Material Engineers
mainHero.members: Team: Austin Martin and Daniel Helm
mainHero.description: Product Snapshot is a custom built data analytics tool for material engineers at the semiconductor manufacturing company Qorvo, designed to streamline production part lookup, integrate real-time data, and analyze production trends and performance metrics. By allowing adjustments to testing limits and test plans, engineers can simulate new runs and gain valuable insights to optimize the manufacturing process.

items.title: Part Lookup by Code and Date
items.description: Quickly locate parts using specific codes and date ranges, streamlining the search process.

items.title: Modification of Testing Limits
items.description: Adjust test limits to meet evolving requirements and standards, ensuring accurate and relevant data analysis.

items.title: Analysis of Material Performance
items.description: Examine production trends and pass/failure rates to enhance quality control and optimize manufacturing processes.

items.title: Integration with Qorvo's Existing Suite of Tools
items.description: The new Product Snapshot is directly integrated with Qorvo's suite of tools, providing a seamless and unified user experience.

items.title: In-Application Documentation
items.description: Access comprehensive documentation within the application, including support contacts and detailed guides for using all of Qorvo's tools.

items.title: Customized to Fit Specific Needs
items.description: Unlike the previous version built with Spotfire, this tool is custom-built using React and MirageJS to better meet the specific needs of Qorvo's material engineers. It seamlessly integrates with their current suite of data analysis tools, ensuring all tools are located in one place.

items.name: React.js
items.description: Utilized to create an intuitive and visually appealing user interface.

items.name: MirageJS
items.description: Employed to simulate backend functionalities during development, ensuring robust testing and seamless integration.

whySnapshot.title: Why Our Product Snapshot?
whySnapshot.subtitle: A Superior Tool for Material Engineers
whySnapshot.description: Our Product Snapshot offers enhanced customization, better integration, and superior performance compared to existing solutions. Built from the ground up with modern technologies, it provides material engineers with a powerful tool to optimize manufacturing processes and gain valuable insights into production data.

items.name: Enhanced Customization
items.description: Tailored specifically to meet the unique needs of Qorvo's material engineers.

items.name: Seamless Integration
items.description: Fully integrated with Qorvo's existing suite of analytical tools.

items.title: Comprehensive Documentation for Qorvo Employees
items.description: In-application documentation is available for all of Qorvo's tools, along with contact information for support. This ensures that material engineers have all the resources they need to effectively use the Product Snapshot.

items.title: Non-Qorvo Users
items.description: Because this tool is custom-built for Qorvo, non-Qorvo users will not have access to the application or codebase. However, custom built apps can be developed for other companies based on their specific needs.

items.title: Contact Information
items.description: If you would like to learn more about Product Snapshot or custom built data analytics tools, please contact Austin Martin or Daniel Helm.

sections.name: About Product Snapshot
sections.content: Product Snapshot is designed to help material engineers at Qorvo efficiently look up production parts by code and date range, analyze production performance, and modify testing limits to gain deeper insights and optimize manufacturing processes. Built with modern technologies such as React and Python Flask, it offers enhanced customization and integration with Qorvo's suite of tools.

sections.name: Contact Information
sections.content: For more information about Product Snapshot, contact Austin Martin at martaust@oregonstate.edu or Daniel Helm at helmd@oregonstate.edu.
